root.name: SVG
root.description: This class stores graphics in the SVG vector format and can draw them to the screen. SVG stands for Scalar Vector Graphics, a portable graphics format. Most modern media software can view SVG files, including Firefox, Adobe products, etc. You can use software such as Inkscape or Illustrator to create and edit SVG files before they are loaded.

method.mdescription: Draws the SVG to the screen
Changes the way the parameters to draw() are interpreted
Overrides SVG-set styles and uses PGraphics styles and colors
Get's a particular element based on its SVG ID

cparameter.cdescription: String: name of the file to load
